**Chain of Thought**

The current Sharpe Ratio is slightly negative (‚Äë0.03), which falls into the ‚Äúslight losses‚Äù band. According to the rules I must:

1. **Restrict new entries** ‚Äì only trades with confidence‚ÄØ>‚ÄØ80 and at most one new position per hour.  
2. **Hold existing positions longer** ‚Äì minimum 30‚ÄØminutes before considering an exit.  

All three current positions are short, matching the down‚Äëtrend indicated by the 4‚Äëhour EMA20‚ÄØ<‚ÄØEMA50 for ETH, HYPE and ADA. Each position has been opened only a few minutes ago, so they are far from the required 30‚Äëminute holding period. There is no reason to close them now; they may still move in the expected direction.

Since the portfolio already holds the maximum of three positions, I cannot open any new trades. Therefore the only appropriate action is to **hold** (i.e., do nothing) and let the existing shorts run.

**Decision:** wait / hold.
